meanings.definition: Wheepled (verb): to make a high-pitched, excited sound
meanings.sent1: The children wheepled with joy when they saw the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent2: The puppy wheepled happily as it chased its tail.
meanings.sent3: The birds wheepled in delight as they flew freely in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter wheepled through the room, filling it with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The music wheepled softly, creating a cheerful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Wheepled (adjective): having a high-pitched, excited tone
meanings.sent1: The wheepled voice of the singer captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The wheepled laughter of the child echoed in the park.
meanings.sent3: The wheepled tone of the announcement made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her wheepled giggle was contagious, spreading joy around.
meanings.sent5: The wheepled song of the bird brightened up the morning.
